intro: Marsippospermum grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered Marsippospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences composed of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a leathery texture with a slightly serrated margin. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
